intro: Stegolepis albiflora, commonly known as the white-flowered stegolepis, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant produces small, white, tubular flowers that are typically arranged in clusters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a glossy surface. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and streamside areas.
